cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the channel state information (CSI) acquisition strategy in massive multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) systems, which is a topic related to information theory (cs.IT) and networked systems (cs.NI). The use of covariance matrices and non-orthogonal pilot sequences also suggests a potential connection to statistical inference (cs.ST) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper specifically focuses on the benefits of covariance-aided CSI acquisition in massive MIMO, which falls under the category of signal processing (cs.SP) and communication (cs.MM).
